results.title: Birds of our storybooks
results.brief_description: Birds which children encounter in their stories and texts are observed in their natural habitats and as they appear in book illustrations. Birds included are the robin, cardinal, crow, owl, sparrow, wren, woodpecker, jay and seagull. Their characteristics - colouring, song and habits are integrated with poems and stories at the primary level.

results.title: Biochemistry and molecular structure
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the role of molecular structure in determining biological activity. Shows correlation of structure and biological activity of sulfanilamide with a vitamin essential to bacterial growth as one example, then considers the effect on human cell growth of compounds similar to some found in cell chromosomes. Time-lapse photography shows the effect of one such compound, 5-fluorouracil, on growth of cancer cells. No other credits available.

results.title: Bill Cosby on prejudice
results.brief_description: In a makeup that is a cross between the mask of an African storyteller and a harlequin, comic Bill Cosby’s bigot destroys the human race. Under his spoofing lies a serious comment that stimulates honest discussion of the problems of racial prejudice. Photographer: Walter Eby; music: Willie Ruff.

results.title: Big Eildon
results.brief_description: The film conveys a vivid impression of the extent of the vast engineering project being undertaken to enlarge the Eildon Dam to nine times its former storage capacity. Working night and day, heavy earth moving equipment is transforming the countryside, building a dam which will provide irrigation water for the Goulburn Valley and hydro-electric power for use throughout Victoria. No other credits available.

results.title: The Big day
results.creator_credit: Chris Fitchett and Audio Visual Workshop
results.brief_description: Suggests that one is wise to plan years ahead financially and otherwise, to be ready for retirement when the time comes. Cast includes Bill Kelly, Jennifer Hearne and Trevor Kilgour. Photographer: John Ruane.

results.title: A Big country
results.creator_credit: Roland Litchfield and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description: Throughout Australia aluminium is being used more and more in a multitude of industries and particularly in transport. Across vast tracts of country aluminium road transports, buses, railway carriages, and aeroplanes fly daily. Fishing boats and pleasure craft, caravans and land are all now produced in aluminium. Tip trucks, plank floor trays and wheat hoppers, as well as domestic items such as foil have all been affected by the “aluminium revolution”.

results.title: Big city 1980
results.brief_description: In Big City 1980, host Garry Moore presents a discussion on how big cities might be seen in the future by contrasting two cities in the present, Brasilia and the redeveloping city of Philadelphia. The highlight of this program is the amazing futurist city of Brasilia, the capital of Brazil. This instant city was entirely built in a period of 5 years. Every street is an expressway and underpasses eliminate the use of intersections. It is a capital city where government buildings dominate, so this allows a unity in futurist architecture throughout, which looks like a giant set for a science fiction film. Important footage of the city is shown during its development stages. Lucio Costa won the competition for Brasilia’s master plan and Oscar Niemeyer designed the major government building. America’s first planned city of Philadelphia is also profiled along with the controversial plans of redevelopment, which will see the city into the future. Plans made by architects and designers of futurist cities are also shown towards the end of the program. This program was presented on the Tomorrow series by CBS News.

results.title: Beyond the shadows
results.creator_credit: Stan Phillips and Western Cine Productions
results.brief_description: The problems of mental retardation. How, through self-initiated effort, the people of Colorado Springs took steps to overcome their fears and prejudices against the mentally retarded and united in a programme to help provide health, welfare, educational and evaluation services to the handicapped.

results.title: The Bespoke overcoat
results.brief_description: Fender has worked as a clerk for many years in the cold warehouse of Ranting & Co., and wants one of the warm sheepskin overcoats stacked around him. Ranting refuses, and Fender asks his friend Morry the tailor to make a coat for him. However, Fender is fired and dies of cold before the coat is finished. His troubled ghost returns to Morry, and persuades him to help him take what he feels is his due - a sheepskin coat from Ranting’s warehouse.
